answers.answer: Find a free clinic or a county hospital.And start writing letters to your legislators about the importance of nationalized health insurance.
I agree with barn babe. I just thought I would add that you can find a free clinic or a clinic that sees patients' on the sliding scale by calling your Governor.

Depending on where you live, Mexico might be an option.  I'm considering visiting Mexico for dental work in the not too distant future (although I understand you have to have a passport now...so it might be in the distant future afterall!).

This country has got to start helping the common person . so much for healthcare is just ridiculous. insurance companies squeezing every dime out of us just for their own gain.I saw this video on youtube the other day.. really got me thinking

This may sound a bit off the wall, but contact the Barter Connection, or any group that sponsors barter networking.  You may be able to contact someone in the medical profession that is willing to do this for you, in exchange for something you can do for them e.g. data entry, flyer distribution, web site design, answering the phones part time.

Find a part time job at Walmart, McDonalds, etc. and get on their group plan.  It is guaranteed insurability, and will cover all pre-existing conditions.  This time of year the IRS is hiring for overnight and shift work data transcribers and customer service reps.I knew a lady near me, who had Osteoperosis and Diabetes.  She works 16 hours a week at Baby's R Us, and she gets group health coverage.Sitting around mulling it over and over will do nothing for you, emotionally, nor healthwise.  You can also contact Cover The Uninsured (google them).  They might have some options for you.

question: 3 months a go I had a severe chest pain on the left side and eventually went to emergency service. It was diagnosed as chest wall pain and I was adviced to take iboprofen and rest. It has been 3 months although now it isn't severely painful it still hurts a lot and I suspect that diagnose may not be too accurate.I am currently unemployed I had no choice but to go to emeregency 3 months ago, but now I can live with it(i can breath now, 3 months ago couldn't even breath)I don't have insurance and don't have any info about health insurance and I do not have the financial power to pay for prospective tests that might be required for diagnosis.  According to my research chest wall pain must have been healed long time ago. What should i do to learn the cause of the pain in my chest?
title: Financial inability to see a doctor
